column5: Heheh, this should be fun!!!   I'll get my sweetie, Uncle Buck to shovel the driveway   (jks) He'll probably make me do it

There is probably close to 8 inches on the ground here already, schools have already called and they will be closed again tomorrow. All kinds of accidents on the highways, some counties have closed their roads except for emergency vehicles.  Best bet in weather like this is to log onto OFC and chill out! No travel!
We are getting some in burlington now... making its way over to oakville/missisauga/Toronto... Any in those areas yet?

Nothing here yet in Downtown Toronto. But the temps have drop considerably I can feel my finger tips turn ice cold. Just happened a few seconds ago.  But I'm glad things will be all done with Friday cause I'm heading out with fish4me for some lakers and white fish hopefully.  dsn

Started here in south-central PA this morning and we have several inches on the ground now.  Just changed over to sleet and freezing rain about an hour ago.  Much more to come for us - just not sure how much snow or how much of the frozen stuff.  Tomorrow morning should be interesting.  I hear the further north of us you go - the more snow they are go get.  At least that is what they are reporting for Northern PA and into New York.
Just starting here in Etobicoke at the 427.Was like this in Oakville at 10 this morning.
if its a snow day expect a fishing report from me Gonna have to walk to the river though
All Hamilton and Halton schools closed for tommrow jsut confirmed. Woot
Yes!! I work for the HDSB!! Just saw that on the news.Not a cm of snow here in south Etobicoke yet.

I just got home (I live on the North York/Etobicoke border) and it is certainly coming down out there! Been heavy since about 6-6:30 this evening.. I was out running errands and shtuff and got stuck in it pretty bad. A couple centimetres on the ground already and cars are having trouble stopping. I almost got hit a couple times crossing the street.  Drivers, give yourself lots of braking room before a stoplight. It's slippery out there. Don't speed, take your time. Hope most of you are inside and toasty warm right now anyway. Don't go out unless you have to.
Still Coming down really hard here in burlington... Gonna be white outhere in the morning
Looks like the streets and highways are pretty much covered this morning...http://www.mto.gov.on.ca/english/traveller/compass/camera/burlington/camhome.htm
HEY..............YOU GUYS WERE TO KEEP THIS STUFF BELOW HWY 7,NOW YOU CAN GET UP HERE AND SHOVEL MY DRIVE WAY.

Kinda nice with that strong wind that was blowing all night, it kept my place nearly snow free. There was no snow at all on my truck and the driveway was almost as clean. I went out an hour ago and it took me 5 minutes to get things cleaned up.  Think I'll sit back now with another coffee, and watch all the traffic jams on the morning news

Brought some work home yesterday, so I'll be working from here!  Roads are of course a mess and GO transit reporting delays and one Lakeshore train already cancelled this morning. Not worth the hassle!  Now, if I could find a nice wind sheltered place to fish....lol.

It ain`t pretty out here! LOL Lucky momma doesn`t go to work till noon  today, she might not get out of the garage now. Still snowing and blowing, guessing between 12 and 16 inches on the ground. It is supposed to start clearing later in the day.
The storm is just starting here not enough snow to keep me home but we know it will get worse.  On the road again.MTP

HOLY CRAP!!! I jsut woke up and the shed is half way burried my dad's car is all covered the snow is half way up to the doors!! We must of gotten over 60cm. There calling for 15-20 more for Hamilton cause of lake effect. We could see 70-80 when its all done. Biggest storm I ever seen  I wish I had a camera right about now.
I think all the snow blew in my driveway Lew. We got lucky here in Toronto, not much snow really, no school closings etc...     cheers,  ehg

My house was a disaster...  had to turn the snow blower on... ( got it back in 2000, and this was the 10th time using it...)  the snow level was over the porch, about 5 feet in total...  you have no idea how many donuts i did in the court today...
sorry bout that Eric, I wondered where it all ended up

Still waiting for the farmer to show up and plow my drive, he uses a large articulated farm tractor with like a 12 foot blade. Couple of passes and he is done! Traffic is a mess here, parts of interstates closed due to accidents, reporting a record snowfall for Cleveland 15.7? inches in 24 hours.  On the bright side it`s on it`s way out weather radar snows it clearing in Huron and Sandusky, 50-60 miles west of Cleveland. Next Tuesday a high of 33 F! LOL summer!
2cms here in montreal..the storm was downgraded   were only supposed to get 15-20cms
We are getting it heavy hear in St.Hubert Carl and you only live 45 minutes form here we have had 15cm so far.I guess you will have to bring your sled out our way.

mike the storms winding down  and we have a total of 20cms.. bot bad although we were expecting 40cms for the montreal region. oh well next storm we will get it good.. its so weird cuz at one point we were supposed to get 50cms.. it gives us total of 60cms on the ground to date

I can't loose either way.  If it misses us I work inside if it dosen't I'll be working outside.  I've already  filled the one plow with diesel and the other with gas so I don't have to do it in the colder snowy weather should it arrive.    I enjoy plowing snow...you make money having fun.
Well, in Toronto and surrounding area, they're predicting 10cm, so we should expect 1 to 100 cm's of snow. DANG weather forcasters !

LOL Carp...environment canada is now saying for Toronto....12 to 19cm tomorrow alone...not including anything we get on Wednesday.  Weathernetwork is saying 10-15cm not including Wednesday.  Wonder if it will be like the last one....I woke up in the morning and we had NOTHING!!! LOL
well they dont know for montreal yet but  one person says 15cm.. then accuweather says 30-45cm.. and meteo media says 25 cms... who knows but i know one thing il be out sledding

Glen that would be 12 inches Glen in the good old imperial system.  This is a good time to pick up a snowblower folks Wallymart has had some on sale $900.00 for a 10.5hp.  Snow no problem!!!!!!!!Winter tires make a big difference.  No help from the army required here in Montreal!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Oh great, no more mail for me again tomorrow  Joey
well i suppose it's about time southern ont. got hit.  woke up to a fresh 19" two weekends ago up north.  not looking forward to the gridlock around the city though.
It's that darned Jet Stream, looks like it takes a left turn in Albuquerque!!!

well if we even get 10cm of snow we all know what traffic will be around the GTA,  so we all might as well call in sick and go ice fishing...  ..they said on global news that its going to last over tuesday & wednesday,with lots of windy blowing snow,so things will be a mess..  .everyone take care driving  and make it home safe...

30+ for hamilton because of the winds coming off the lake. Blizzard liek conditions and visibility at 0. Sounds like no school  Although last time they said that I woke up to 2 cm of snow and 3 inches of ice.

Well,we had to get it sometime. It'd be weird actually if we got lucky all year. I thought the west coast was going to keep it LOL ...... it was their turn. Hopefully all we get is some good toboganning and everyone uses their heads. I hope it's all cleared up for the fishing show. I'm "Jones'n" for something fishing related.  Everyone take care tomorrow (no power outages please). It's funny, I used to freak just thinking of that thought when I had a saltwater tank (corals etc.). I gave it up for a projector and camping/fishing. I figured I ALWAYS had to be here to take care of it and with camping etc. I just couldn't do it. I was fun too though,just way more time consuming, more stresssful and less filling LOL (actually I haven't kept ANY fish yet,but the Walleye are calling me) LOL..
UA1990, Toronto to New York is more like 553 Kms.  200 klicks might get you to Deseronto.  Irregardless, we gonna get some weather.
553.3 Kms to be exact
Doug, I think you should head into work now...sleep on your desk..so you're on time in the morning.! LOL

Hmm.. and just in time for Valentine's day... I guess there's no point in me getting my hair done, lol. The wind and snow will just undo it in two seconds.  PS- I like the new smilies. I might have to borrow Davey Crocket's hat up there to keep warm. Either his or Uncle Buck's white one. Not only warm but apparently lucky.

Well we've had a winter storm warning since Saturday and it finally got here after midnight last night. They had pretty much cancelled everything here last night before it even got here Got up at five and shoveled the first six inches of what supposed to be 10-12" today. I was getting ready to leave for work and all my guys called off so I'm thinking what the point, looks like I'll have to find something to do today  Whopper

Well so far they are only calling for 10-15cm for the Brockville area Wed. but the 30Km/hr winds will make it just lovely.  I feel a sick day coming on.  At least we wont get what upstate NY got last week. Oswego area has 12ft+ snow drifts

The wife got up at 5am around 6 the schools called and canceled for the day, better plan than last time, let them get to school and send them home at noon. Maybe 20 inches of snow from this system here. It`s not nice out now.

drove in hamilton this morning and white out conditions and icey roads.  here in oakville its blowing but light snow.  weird how oakville east to pickering always seems to miss the squalls.  apparently when the storm rolls in we are not going to miss it.  oh well i have been dieing to use my snowblower this year!  Be safe if you have to drive all!  Cheers!
We are getting a major rain storm here in lousiville. But its blizzard just a little bit north of us in indianapolis.
now whos the smartass...
WOW!!! We're getting hammered here in Hamilton. Been snowing all day and they said this isn't even the storm?   Already got  20-25cm!!!
send some over here, east on qew, we havnt got a sprinkle yet...

LOl, don't worry it's coming. Were getting pounded by lake effect right now. And another 20-30 from the storm and they said we can possibly see over 50+ because lake effect.. My back is going to hurt tommrow  Hope its a snowday. Woot woot, Too bad I don't got the cam to snaps some pics.

I saw that on the TV awhile ago xrap, you guys are getting clobbered.  Nothing in Toronto yet but it sounds like it's on the way.  Guess we can't complain too much though, the news said Toronto has received the least amount of snow this year ever.
Calling for 30cm of snow and blizzard-like conditions. Careful if travelling!! http://weatheroffice.ec.gc.ca/warnings/report_e.html?onrm19
So I shouldn't plan on fishing much that day?? darn it!! LOL.
no it means you should plan on not going to work (cause of dangerouse driving conditions) and go fishing instead!
DOH!! Why didn't I think of that...gotta go home and sharpen some hooks....LOL
Rick...did you replace that lock on your shed yet???LOL
No but I got the thing open and thats good enough for now.
Yup, what RicoB said, but leave earlier  , you know, ( dangerous driving condition)
of course there is....cause Charlie  planned a fishing trip from Tuesday to Monday....figures!
Well you all be careful with that dusting ya hear.LOL   About time someone else got some of the winter stuff.  Walking these lakes is a be atch.
Oh man...that sucks!  I think I remember you mentioning heading to Quinte soon.  Maybe it will miss us??
Cant seem to get that Link to work. I've been doing some repairs on the S'blower, fuel line,starter rope and an auger shearpin. Sounds like I got 'er done just in time
HMMM TX FOR THE UPDATE BRO!!! I'LL HAVE TO RECONSIDER TOMORS TROUT OUTING NOW!!!

We've had it good here in Toronto this winter as far as snowfall goes, I think the weather channel said we've had a grand total of 9 cm, while everyone around here has gotten clobbered.  Kinda nice too, there's just too much traffic around here and it only takes a few inches to shut this town down.  We've dodged a few storms, hopefully we'll duck this one too.  The radio says we're only looking at about 10 cm for the Smoke....hopefully
Hope not much here as I can't shovel with my back.  Oh well call someone in to plow I guess.

yes I am ...tomorrow...guess i will head out earlier i guess....gonna take me awhile to get to Quinte, as I am coming from Niagara Falls.  I am getting mixed reports for places....some say near Belleville and some say near Picton...don't know where to go...LOL.  Well the report for quinte says 5cm....but a wind temp of -29....that will suck...hopefully not real heavy winds...LOL

i want a load of of snow! how come in new york, maybe 200kms away from toronto gets 3 metres of snow   and we dont see none of it? im moving to new york, hey FishHeadRic ill share an apartment with u haha
yep I wil be bringing my snowboard with me...in case the fishing sucks...then I can just go snowboarding...lol
SWEEET SNOW DAY, I hope so, NO SCHOOL!!!    jodan

For us up here in winter wonderland that  is normal snowfall, at least it has been this winter. I guess it could be kind of tough though, if your not use to it.  Stay safe and watch for those blue lights.  Tom
The only Turkey's in Penetang that don't seem to mind trudging thru 3 feet of snow...LOL
I sense a sick-day could be in order.
Hmmm I wonder what could it be? Snow or major rain?    All I know is that I had a dream and I saw dark skys and people running. Hope this dream doesn't come true.    dsn
hmm dsn, intresting dreams ya got...  hmm u sure that wasnt me trying to run away from my parents haha
30 cm.?... how many degrees Celcius is that?
Rick, you got no excuse now pal.... If I have to come over and show you where your shed is I will!!!
